item.title: [667/718] Ingame Admin CP
item.dc:creator: @Fox2007 Fox2007
item.description:
@Fox2007 wrote:

        @Override
        public void start() {
                if (stage == -1) {
                        sendOptionsDialogue("<col=FF0000>Admin Panel",
                                        "Hide",
                                        "Staff Island",
                                        "Bot Island",
                                        "Bot Court");
                        stage = 1;
                }
        }

Stage by default is -1, so no need for what he said above. just remove stage = 1 at the top and change the 1 in the if statement to -1. And really, there’s not a need for the if statement at all…

Read full topic

item.title: [667/718] Ingame Admin CP
item.dc:creator: @NukeRune NukeRune
item.description:
@NukeRune wrote:

Hi there,
This will make your teleport called “Slayer Teleports” or W/E in your quest tab popup a admin cp for only admins, and let them choose between Slayer Teleports or Admin CP.
This is really simple to add, but still some people’s are so newby that they need to ask :palm:
If you want to leech go ahead.

Create a new Dialogue called “Admincp” add this in it:

[code]
package com.rs.game.player.dialogues;

import com.rs.game.WorldTile;
import com.rs.game.player.content.Magic;
import com.rs.game.player.Skills;

public class Admincp extends Dialogue {

@Override
public void start() {
	stage = 1;
	if (stage == 1) {
		sendOptionsDialogue("Select an Option",
				"Slayer teleports",
				"Admin panel");
		stage = 1;
	}
}

public void run(int interfaceId, int componentId) {
	if (stage == 1) {
		int option;
		if (componentId == OPTION_1) {
       				player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("SlayerTeleports", 230);
		}
		if (componentId == OPTION_2) {
       				player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("Admincp", 230);
		}
	}
}

@Override
public void finish() {

}

}[/code]

And add this Dialogue called “Admin”:

[code]
package com.rs.game.player.dialogues;

import com.rs.game.WorldTile;
import com.rs.game.ForceTalk;
import com.rs.game.player.content.Magic;
import com.rs.game.player.Skills;

public class Admin extends Dialogue {

@Override
public void start() {
	stage = 1;
	if (stage == 1) {
		sendOptionsDialogue("<col=FF0000>Admin Panel",
				"Hide",
				"Staff Island",
				"Bot Island",
				"Bot Court");
		stage = 1;
	}
}

public void run(int interfaceId, int componentId) {
	if (stage == 1) {
		int option;
		if (componentId == OPTION_1) {
			player.getAppearence().switchHidden();
			player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("<img=6>Only Administrators can see you <col=FFF000>  " + player.getAppearence().isHidden());
			player.getInterfaceManager().closeChatBoxInterface();
		}
		if (componentId == OPTION_2) {
			Magic.sendNormalTeleportSpell(player, 0, 0, new WorldTile(3122,
					3114, 0));
			end();
		}
		if (componentId == OPTION_3) {
			Magic.sendNormalTeleportSpell(player, 0, 0, new WorldTile(3673,
					3616, 0));
			end();
		}
		if (componentId == OPTION_4) {
			player.setNextWorldTile(new WorldTile(3680, 3623, 0));
			player.getInterfaceManager().closeChatBoxInterface();
		}

	}
}

@Override
public void finish() {

}

}[/code]

Add this in “DialogueHandler.Java”:

			handledDialogues.put("Admincp", (Class<Dialogue>) Class
					.forName(Admincp.class.getCanonicalName()));

And then add this:

			handledDialogues.put("Admin", (Class<Dialogue>) Class
					.forName(Admin.class.getCanonicalName()));

Go to “RunePortal.Java” and replace any quest tab line with this:

else if (componentId == 14) { if (player.getRights() != 2) { player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("SlayerTeleports", 230);//Normal players } else { player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("Admincp", 230);//Only admins return;

A picture:

You can start complaining about my snippet now.

~NukeRune

Read full topic
